Cloud computing

Sometimes a simple hosting and a domain are not enough.
When you need a bunch of different tools, check out the cloud computing companies.

AWS

  • Free tier for the first 12 months
  • Some services have free forever tiers
  • More features than competition
  • Longest time on market
    (more 3rd party libraries,
    better documentation)
  • Open AWS

Google Cloud

  • $300 free credits to spend during first 12 months
  • Always Free tier:
    1 f1-micro VPS
    1 GB NoSQL DB,
    28 hours/day of Google App Engine,
    5 GB of cloud storage
    2 000 000 cloud functions invocations
    and more
  • Open Google Cloud

Azure

  • $200 free credits to spend during 30 days
  • 12 months free trial of some services:750 hours/month of
    Linux and Windows VM,
    2x 64GB managed disks,
    5GB of File storage,
    250GB SQL database and more
  • Always free tier:
    10 web, mobile or API apps,
    1 000 000 serverless functions/month
    and more
  • Good support for Windows application
  • Open Azure

Cloud computing platforms are complex and hard to compare (the list of features and pricing is changing often).
Based on a specific use case, you will have to pick the best option yourself. Check those articles if you need help choosing: Sitepoint, Hacker News, RightScale.

Affiliate links

Affiliate links have a special code in the URL. If you register from this link, some companies will give free credits to either both of us or just to me (depending on how a company set up their affiliation program - I always ask if they have some coupon codes that will give credits to both sides). Those credits can be used on their website (for a few months of free hosting, a cheaper domain, etc.) or redeemed for money (only for domains providers).

Affiliation program doesn't affect whether a company is recommended or not. You can read more about how I select companies/tools on the About & contact page.
